steps.content:
This tool helps you sanitize log files before sharing them with external vendors or support teams.

‚ö†Ô∏è Important: You are responsible for exporting logs using the correct procedures and paths. This tool only removes sensitive content from the files you provide.

steps.title: Navigation
steps.content:
Secure Files - Upload and sanitize logs
My Words - Add custom terms to redact
My Jobs - Track batch processing
Help - Documentation & tips

steps.title: Step 1: Upload Files
steps.content:
Drag & drop your log files here, or click to browse.

Supports: .log, .txt, .zip, .tar.gz, .json, .xml, .csv

steps.title: Detailed Replacement Report
steps.content:
Enable this option to generate a CSV showing exactly what was replaced: line numbers, original values, and replacement tokens.

Useful for auditing and learning what the tool detects.

steps.title: Step 2: Process Files
steps.content: Click here to start sanitization. Processing happens on the server - your files never leave the organization's network.

steps.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Critical: Save Your Results!
steps.content:
After processing completes, you MUST download and save all files and reports immediately.

‚ùå Reports cannot be retrieved later - they are automatically deleted after your session ends.

‚úÖ Always save:
‚Ä¢ Sanitized files (.zip)
‚Ä¢ Mapping report (for reference)
‚Ä¢ Detailed CSV report (if enabled)

steps.title: Custom Sensitive Terms
steps.content:
Add organization-specific terms that should be redacted: project names, client names, or internal codenames.

These are stored encrypted in your browser.

steps.title: Batch Job Tracking
steps.content: When processing ZIP files with many logs, track progress here. Download results when jobs complete.

steps.title: Your Session
steps.content:
View your current session info and logout when done.

Remember: all temporary files are deleted on logout.
